page.title: 20ST. PETER'S CHURCH
page.content: St. Peter's Church is a small church in Halfway. It was dedicated by the Archbishop of Canterbury on the 8th October,1973. In the church there is a picture of a sculpture of the Virgin and Child. The sculpture belonged to Minster Abbey but was sold to the Victoria and Albert Museum in London for a sum of Â£7500. Half of this sum was given to St. Peter's, the daughter church of Minster Abbey, enabling the church to be free of debt. The sculpture is thought have formed part of a column or screen which included the Blessed Virgin and also St. Sexburgha, the founder of Minster Abbey in 674 AD. St. Peter's has a visitors book with signatures of people from places such as Aylesbury and Holland.
